channel.title: Programming on Philosopher of Language
channel.description: Recent content in Programming on Philosopher of Language

item.title: Programming
item.description: Recently, I’ve been programming in C++ and I am really happy with the language. Function signatures form their own grammar, and I rely heavily on this for calculation I rely heavely on reading funciton declarations. Having them in header files seperated from their definitions, makes C++ easier to read than C# where you have to wade through the definitions to read the signature. Without static typing, languages like Python are totally incomprehensible to me.
